subject: Re: [junit] Enhancing JUnit myself, how to?
msgSnippet: ... I m guessing errorCode is specific to your exception class?  If so, it s unlikely that this would be useful to JUnit users in general. On the other hand,
messageBody:
On Wed, Oct 21, 2009 at 8:00 AM, remoliechti <remo.liechti@...> wrote:

> Well, the exception contains an error code which should be checked as well,
> so I thought, why not enhancing JUnit to check this as well:
> @Test(expected=MyException.class,errorCode=5)
>
I'm guessing "errorCode" is specific to your exception class? If so, it's
unlikely that this would be useful to JUnit users in general.

On the other hand, something that I've found useful in TestNG is being able
to test the error message against a regular exception:

@Test(expectedException=MyException.class, errorMessage = ".*Too big.*")

You might want to consider this for JUnit since it's applicable regardless
of the exception class.

--
Cédric
